column69: The gratification of overcoming an obstacle is my greatest motivator. For example, math has never been my best subject, but I opted to take calculus in college, even though it wasn’t required for my major because I wanted to prove to myself I could do it. The course wasn’t easy, and I spent many nights studying late, but I passed with an A. The feeling of accomplishment that comes with exceeding challenging goals is what drew me to a career in Product Management.
column70: When I was in school, I completed an internship at a large corporation. I learned a lot about how a business operates, but my experience was focused on one particular department, and I did not have much crossover into other areas. I spoke with an alumnus who worked here in the past, and she told me how much she enjoyed gaining exposure to all the parts that make a small business work. I believe that kind of work environment plays to my strengths as a flexible and cooperative person. I'm willing to do any job that is needed.

column69: I've always been drawn to the overlap between design, development and problem-solving. Eventually, my interests led me to choose my career as a UX/UI Designer. As a result of my education at Conestoga College (Canada) and self-study, I got experience in producing creative designs for web pages with the help of real-life projects. I am passionate about building websites and bringing my designs to life.  Nowadays, I keep learning and continue challenging myself and doing interesting things that matter to the world, to others and to me. And I believe that my passion will help me succeed in a UX design role because I enjoy what I do, and my personality fits the work I do daily.
column70: By doing this internship, I want to achieve a real world experience by collaborating with other designers worldwide to provide design solutions for a user-friendly website or an app. I want to understand the complete process of  what goes into making a design good and user friendly. column69:
I always love to plan ahead of my life, such as my career path. Since the first year of university, I’ve been looking for something to put my passion and experiences into one. I’ve always wanted my future job to be a combo of creativity, technical skills, and a platform for me to help people. J.R.R Tolkien said that even the smallest person can change the course of the future, and that's what I dreamed to do: to help people in their daily tasks and solve problems in the world. 

I realised that UXUI design is the perfect match. It incorporated my past experience, my university major, my goals, and most importantly, I am willing to learn more about it to ace any challenges that come with it. This is why I want to do more UXUI internships and launch my career in this direction, because I can see a clear path of continued studies, passion and stability.
column70:
-Gain professional working experience in UXUI.
-Work on hands on UXUI projects.
-Collaborate with other UXUI designers and interns, as UX is a team sport.

Introduction to User Experience Design: This course has been offered by the Georgia Institute of Technology on the Coursera platform. Topics that are covered in this course include Requirement Gathering, designing mobile and ubiquitous computing systems that meet the usability constraints
that were identified, Prototyping, and Evaluation

Design Thinking: UX and Advanced Topics: This course has been offered by Microsoft on the edX platform. Topics that are covered in this course includes User Needfinding, User Experience Design, and basic principles of Interface Architecture

column69:
There is a disconnect between the theoretical ideas that are taught in colleges and the real-world experience that employers are clamoring for in recruits. I will make use of RadicalX training programs as a current student to gain the necessary real-world practical knowledge. The internship's flexible remote nature also perfectly matches my learning requirements. I may pick and select different internships to tailor the my exprience into my desired field.

The flexible aspect of RadicalX training programs is one of the things that drew me to the training program since it allows me to better manage my time. Overall, developing my brand is my primary motivation for pursuing the training courses. In order to establish a competitive profile to enter the industry as a university student, RadicalX training would be extremely helpful. It would give vital information and insight into product marketing and development.
column70: By the end of this internship, I plan on mastering real-world in-demand skills that would enhance my competitiveness in the job market.  I am looking forward to being able to make a difference during my educational and professional journey. The product marketing internships fit directly into my desired career path, therefore I will be planning to leverage the experience and professional network I will gain during the internship for my career development.
